response.answer_text: In the eyes of GOVT. as well as legally it is valid to pursue any higher education. But our Indian society will never accept . They think Open education is waste of time and they doesn't value a student who does education by Open means, not only NIOS but they do the same with IGNOU and other open education boards. So i request NIOS students please if you faced any year backs or dropped out of education , continue your education with NIOS and prove the society wrong who say NIOS is not valid. Some private institutions won't accept NIOS certificates for admission its not because NIOS is not valid, Its because in their eyes or as per their standards NIOS has no value . Don't join such institutes or even don't argue with them . NIOS is a well recognised board run by MHRD in India and has definitely good value if you have registered online legally and written exams without any malpractices and passed based on your own hardwork.

As you would be aware, the National Institute of Open Schooling (NIOS) also runs Open Basic Education Programmes through Distance Education Mode (Open Learning System) at the Elementary stage and awards Joint Certificates with the partnering NGO's at three level (equivalent to class III or class II of the Southern States where elementary stage is only till class VII), B level (equivalent to class V/VI) and C level (equivalent to class VIII/VII). This is applicable to their programme of equivalency under distance education programme where similar certificates are provided at the same level of competency and equivalency. You may like to issue necessary instructions to all concerned to consider certificates issued by N.I.O.S. jointly with partnering NGOs for the above levels as equivalent to concerned stage of education in matters of admissions and employment etc. Formal communication/Notification regarding grant of recognition to the examinations conducted by National Institute of Open Schooling may issued and the same widely circulated to all concerned.
